intro: Hieracium euroum, commonly known as the European meadow hawkweed, is a perennial flowering plant native to Europe. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils, reaching heights of up to 60 cm. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers consist of yellow disk florets surrounded by ray florets. Hieracium euroum is often found in temperate regions and can spread through rhizomes, making it a persistent weed in agricultural areas.
